review_title: I do not advise working in a physician practice here
job_title: Physician Practice Worker in Atlanta, GA
pros: Benefits are okay, but compensation is sorely lacking
cons: Pay grade classification is not market value, they will not give you raises if you exceed what they believe is market value. Hard to even get qualified help, as they don't want to pay for experience. They'd rather lose good candidates and employees for a cheaper option, which leads to high turnover. Also there is no room for growth - most positions are dead end jobs though management will tell you otherwise during the hiring process. On that note, management is TERRIBLE - they do not care about their employees at all, you'll just be a number to them that is easily replaced. They certainly do not take constructive criticism or try to improve operations when a problem is pointed out.  They will exploit you to the fullest, putting more and more demands on employees and use the excuse that it's part of the "other expectations as set by supervisor" in the job description.  Don't even think about saying that it is too much, or you'll get written up - and definitely don't get overtime, because you'll get in trouble for that too. Management only knows how to function by using fear tactics rather than actually trying to help employees grow and succeed. They have completely forgotten that we are here to take care of patients, not to appease their whims. This has lead to a toxic work culture where everyone from front desk to back office to operations is overworked and stressed out. Basically if you want to be overworked, underappreciated and underpaid, thn this could be the place for you!

job_title: Patent Access Supervisor in Atlanta, GA
pros: Northside is respected throughout the community.  Promotion from within provides abundant opportunity for growth.
cons: There is a lack of cohesion between the various locations and can make transition difficult or create awkward conversations with patients.

pros: Pension Plan, Good PTO. Easy to transfer.
cons: From my experience, anyone who works in an administrative role, really do not matter. I appreciate all the medical professionals and the care they give to patients but an office/hospital CANNOT run without all the hard working people behind the desks. Show appreciation to those workers as well please.
